discussion.content:
Correct answer is A.

Creation from an existing snapshot is not permitted if there are:

Any snapshots present in the file system that were created with the ADVM compatibility set to less than 12.1

Selected Answer: A
A. Correct: ADVM compatibility must be 12.1 or higher for the parent snapshot feature.
B. Incorrect: The parent snapshot can be read/write; it doesn't have to be read-only.
C. Incorrect: High redundancy is not required for creating snapshots.
D. Incorrect: The parent snapshot can be either read/write or read-only.

Selected Answer: A
B - wrong - the parent snap can be RW, but it has to be created on compatible >=12.1

Creation from an existing snapshot is not permitted if there are:

 Any snapshots present in the file system that were created with the ADVM compatibility set to less than 12.1
https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/acfsg/acfs-commands-snapshots.html#GUID-A1E4A4B5-CD16-4ADC-817D-4CD7D2DA12DF

choices.A: The disk group compatibility attribute for ADVM must be set to 12.1 or higher.
choices.D: The parent snapshot must be read/write.
choices.B: The parent snapshot must be read-only.
choices.C: The underlying ADVM volume must be configured with high redundancy.

choices.F: Hub nodes require direct access to the voting disks.
choices.D: Leaf nodes require direct access to the voting disks.
choices.E: Hub nodes require direct access to the OCR file.
choices.C: Each leaf node must be connected to storage shared across all leaf nodes.
choices.A: Each hub node must be connected to storage shared across all hub nodes.
choices.B: Each leaf node must be connected to storage shared across all cluster nodes.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about the Oracle Clusterware 19c Flex Cluster architecture? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AEF
AEF as explained here https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/cwadd/oracle-flex-clusters.html

Selected Answer: AEF
A. Correct - Hub nodes need shared storage accessible to all hub nodes.

B. Incorrect - Leaf nodes do not need to be connected to storage shared across all cluster nodes.

C. Incorrect - Leaf nodes do not require shared storage with other leaf nodes.

D. Incorrect - Leaf nodes do not need direct access to the voting disks.

E. Correct - Hub nodes require direct access to the OCR file.

F. Correct - Hub nodes require direct access to the voting disks.

questions.question_text: Which four statements are true concerning the upgrading of Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABFG
100% ABFG. All environment variable must be unset

Selected Answer: ABFG
Grid upgrades are always out-of-place and you need to unset the environment variables in the preupgrade phase.

Selected Answer: ABFG
ABFG correct answer

Selected Answer: ABDF
A. True. The Cluster Verification Utility (CVU) can be used to verify that the cluster is properly configured for an upgrade.
B. True. CVU can generate fixup scripts to resolve issues detected during the verification process.
D. True. The ORACLE_HOME environment variable must be set to the Grid Infrastructure home directory during the upgrade process.
F. True. The Oracle Universal Installer (OUI) can be used to perform upgrade validation, which includes invoking CVU.

Regarding the other options:

C. False. The ORACLE_SID environment variable does not need to be set to the SID of the ASM instance for the upgrade process.
E. False. An in-place upgrade is not mandatory; out-of-place upgrades are also supported.
G. False. The upgrade does not have to be done out-of-place; both in-place and out-of-place upgrades are possible.

choices.C: The ORACLE_SID environment variable must be set to the SID of the ASM instance in the installation owner's environment.
choices.E: The upgrade must be done in-place.
choices.D: The ORACLE_HOME environment variable must be set to the Grid Infrastructure home directory in the installation owner's environment.
choices.G: The upgrade must be done out-of-place.
choices.A: The cluster verification utility cluvfy.sh can verify that the cluster is ready for an upgrade.
choices.F: Upgrade validation may be done using the Oracle Universal Installer which in turn invokes the built-in cluster verification utility.
choices.B: The cluster verification utility cluvfy.sh can generate fixup scripts to run on all nodes of the cluster.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D: "ASM disk groups used for voting files and OCR files require a quorum failgroup."
This statement is correct. Disk groups that contain Oracle Clusterware files (OCR and voting files) have a higher minimum number of failure groups than other disk groups because the voting files are stored in quorum failure groups. A quorum failure group ensures that a quorum of the specified failure groups are available and is used to determine if the disk group can be mounted if there is a loss of one or more failure groups.

E: The Installer permits the creation of a disk group for use by the voting disks and OCR file is true.
The Oracle Universal Installer can be used to install Oracle Clusterware, which can put the Oracle Cluster Registry (OCR) and the voting files on Oracle Automatic Storage Management (Oracle ASM). The installer provides the option to automatically mirror OCR. Also, the Grid Infrastructure Management Repository can be created in its own disk group during installation of Oracle Grid Infrastructure.

Selected Answer: BE
B but NOT for ASM Instance. ASM Instance can't be in archivelog mode, so recovery area isn't needed. I think this answer is badly transcribed.

A database can use ASM or shared storage independently
C incorrect, ASM diskgroup can be created for the first time after ASM startup
D quorum failgroup is required for voting diskgroup with normal or high redundancy

Selected Answer: BE
A. Incorrect: Databases can use other storage options independently of ASM being used for Clusterware files.
B. Correct: The Installer allows creating a disk group for the Recovery Area during installation.
C. Incorrect: ASM instances can still be started without specifying ASM disk groups during installation.
D. Incorrect: ASM requires redundancy but does not specifically require a "quorum failgroup."
E. Correct: The Installer allows creating a disk group for voting disks and OCR files during installation.

choices.C: If no ASM disk groups are specified during installation, then ASM instances are not started after the installation completes on any cluster node.
choices.E: The Installer permits the creation of a disk group for use by the voting disks and OCR file.
choices.D: ASM disk groups used for voting files and OCR files require a quorum failgroup.
choices.A: If ASM disk groups are configured for the Clusterware files, then ASM must be used for all databases on the cluster.
choices.B: The Installer permits the creation of a disk group to be used for the Recovery Area for the ASM instance.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding ASM when installing Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Set COMPATIBLE.ASM to 11.2, COMPATIBLE.RDBMS to 12.1, and COMPATIBLE.ADVM to 11.2.
choices.E: Set COMPATIBLE.ASM to 11.2, COMPATIBLE.RDBMS to 11.2, and COMPATIBLE.ADVM to 11.2.
choices.D: Set COMPATIBLE.ASM to 12.1, COMPATIBLE.RDBMS to 11.2, and COMPATIBLE.ADVM to 12.1.
choices.B: Set COMPATIBLE.ASM to 12.1, COMPATIBLE.RDBMS to 12.1, and COMPATIBLE.ADVM to 12.1.
choices.C: Set COMPATIBLE.ASM to 11.2, COMPATIBLE.RDBMS to 12.1, and COMPATIBLE.ADVM to 12.1.

questions.question_text:
A cluster running 19c Grid Infrastructure supports both Oracle 11g to 19c RAC databases using ASM.
The COMPATIBLE.ASM, COMPATIBLE.RDBMS, and COMPATIBLE.ADVM parameters are currently set to 11.2 for all diskgroups.
You must support these capabilities in all diskgroups:
1. ACFS Replication
2. ACFS Encryption
To what minimum values must the compatible attributes be set?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Replication status of a disk group requires the COMPATIBLE.ASM to be >=12.1
As a result, the COMPATIBLE.ADVM requires to be equal to COMPATIBLE.ASM.

Selected Answer: D
Replication and Encryption are enable on 11.2.0.3 COMPATIBLE.ASM and COMPATIBLE.ADVM. Value 11.2 for those parameteres does not support those features.

Selected Answer: D
B - wrong - it will not allow the database 11.2 to run on the diskgroup with 12.1 compatible.rdbms.
